context_of_use: This use case allows customers to checkout orders and track their status, while managers can approve orders as needed.
stakeholders_and_interests: customer: wants to complete purchases and track orders
manager: wants to ensure timely order approvals
description: This use case covers the processes of checking out orders, tracking order status, and approving orders where required.
preconditions: Customer has items in the cart.
Customer is logged into the system.
postconditions: Order status is updated for tracking.
Manager has approved the order if required.
assumptions: Customers have valid payment methods available.
Managers are authorized to approve orders.
requirements_met: The system shall allow customers to checkout using multiple payment methods.
The system shall allow customers to track their orders.
The system shall allow managers to approve orders.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the types of payment methods supported.
main_flow: 1. Customer selects checkout → System processes the checkout with multiple payment options.
2. System confirms the order and provides a summary → Customer receives order confirmation.
3. Customer requests order tracking → System retrieves and displays the order status.
4. Manager reviews pending orders → System displays orders awaiting approval.
5. Manager approves the order → System updates the order status to approved.
